dialogues.speaker: military
dialogues.text: Do you have an explanation for this?

dialogues.speaker: scientist
dialogues.text: Sir, with all due respect, this technology is relatively new and-

dialogues.speaker: military
dialogues.text: Hundreds. Hundreds of soldiers died in that expedition. We put our trust in your science, and this is what we get.

dialogues.speaker: scientist
dialogues.text: Our experiments are still in their infancy. We'd appreciate if that factored in to your decision making.

dialogues.speaker: scientist
dialogues.text: It was you who sent out those troops-

dialogues.speaker: scientist
dialogues.text: We'll increase the complexity of our simulations. With the fresh batch of-

dialogues.speaker: scientist
dialogues.text: ...new processing resources, it should be feasible now. We only ask that you give us time.

dialogues.speaker: military
dialogues.text: Time is the one luxury that we can't afford.

dialogues.speaker: military
dialogues.text: I'll leave you to your... instruments. There are lives at stake. Everyone's lives. I hope that... factors in... to your decision making.
